File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_Assault_BossFightIntro.lsj
Synopsis:
When you arrive on the rooftop after making Ketheric vulnerable, he will be shivering and furious at the fact that his invulnerability has been taken from him. The Tower is under attack and he's in a desperate state. He will fight the player, unless by a huge stroke of luck the player convinces him to surrender. Edge-case path: Audience with the Absolute (captured Nightsong then messed up Z'rell)

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_Assault_Jaheira.lsj
Synopsis:
Jaheira lead the harpers to Moonrise after Nightsong was freed. As the player arrives to Moonrise, she greets them and can follow the player for the assault, If she doesn't follow, she will still join combat and move into the tower, in which the player has another oppertunity to have her follow them to fight Ketheric. Once Ketheric flees she will move up to the roof to offer recruitment.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_Audience_AccessCultist.lsj
Synopsis:
The Mistress of Souls won't let us pass into Ketheric's chapel until we've completed MOO quests. Her tone is vaguely respectful, but not as deferential as a True Soul is used to. When we press her on this, we'll see her contempt - True Souls might be a big deal out in the world, but not here. In truth, she is a Myrkul cultist playing her role in the church of the Absolute, secretly contemptuous of every true believer.

> Bet the hag who ripped my eye out is howling from the grave.

> The Absolute is. I burned that druids' grove to the ground.
> Dror Ragzlin isn't. I ripped him and his camp apart.
> The demons of the abyss sing my name and tremble.
> You'll be shrieking my name if you keep asking inane questions.
> No songs. Just screams.
> Nobody sings my name - I don't leave any witnesses.
> The gods - when I slit my enemies' throats and offer their lives up as tribute. Those who bathe in the warmth and light of the one I serve. Friends and enemies alike - for I wield the power of the divine with the ease of breathing.
> Depends on what my magic summons - could be anything from a cow to a mephit. But they're all very musical, I assure you. My dragonblood sings every time I burn an enemy alive. The skies themselves - when they bow to my magic and unleash a tidal wave of power.
> Well, I mainly do the singing. Usually while beating my foes to a pulp - it's quite the sight.
> Nobody sings my name - I don't leave any witnesses.
> Footprints in untrodden places sing my travels and trials.
> Check the calluses on my hands. Those come only from a steadfast grip on a weapon.
> Check my knuckles - I've felled plenty of foes with my fists alone.
> The sinners who've fallen in the face of righteous justice. Forgotten glades and eternal streams whisper their protector's name. Those I am sworn to protect. Those who'd bind another to their will whisper my name in nightmares.
> Perhaps 'warrior' isn't the right word. But I could turn this tower to dust without twitching my finger.
> Open shop, or it will be you howling my name and begging my mercies.
> Oh, no one sings it. But hundreds have died sobbing with my name on their lips.
> Screaming my name, more like. I know how to inflict pain. Show respect, or I'll give you a demonstration.
> I have cut from corpses a thousand tongues, and those thousand tongues sing of murder.
> The Weave itself - for I traverse its depths with the ease of breathing.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_BugBearVendor_AD_Combat.lsj
Synopsis:
Bugbear vendor yells at the player when entering combat. If at least one of the players had impressed him, he wil look forward to the challange of fighting them. If they failed to impresse him, he will taunt them. If not of the players attempted to impress him, he will be existed for the bloodshed regardless.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_CatBusiness.lsj
Synopsis:
As the player explore the surrounding of Moonrise, they can encounter a cat playing with a dead tadpole. Upon interacting with this cat, player can learn where the tadpoles are actually being stored at (SWA) or the location of a nearby tunnel they can use in cat form (Non-SWA). Steelclaw is a murdering psychopath who revels in blood and gore.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_Docks_Vat.lsj
Synopsis:
The player has investigated the vat, showing thousands of tadpoles. They are being used to bolster their number of soldiers for their attack on Baldurs Gate. The player can destroy the Vat, depriving some of their numbers, or utter a phrase to influence whoever these tadpoles end up attached to.

uid: 01982660-e2bf-49de-9cf7-caf3290dde63
> *A pattern of blank minds, newly born. They carry only a bare shred of memory, inherited from something older.*

null
uid: 096121cb-56b7-4882-99be-f306fce64d36
- 0 Set flag(s) to (Object):
   true - ORI_Inclusion_Random - ORI_Inclusion_Randomdescription
> Empty. Void of essence, void of purpose. We cannot allow their birth.
> They don't know what they are - not yet. Unless we taught them to be something else...
> These tadpoles come from an ancient colony down below the tower. Whatever we do with them, we must deny their use to the Absolute.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_Executioner.lsj
Synopsis:
Dialogue with Z'rell when she's upstairs. This takes place after the execution scene, and involves Z'rell mind-melding to see how players dealt with the goblins, and testing their 'desire' to be one with the Absolute via a second mind-meld. She then gives them the mission to aid Balthazar, giving them the key to his chamber, and instructing them to find evidence of where he can be found.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_FlyingGhoul.lsj
Synopsis:
The player encounters a pack of winged ghouls on Moonrise's upper exterior. They are disgusting undead who are eternally starving for dead and rotting flesh. Though intelligent, they can be near feral in their need to feed. In this case, the player meets a still-intelligent one with two less-bright comrades. The leader challenges the player, saying the cult has promised them plenty of meat but they've received none. Instead, the corpses are dropped below the tower (unbeknownst to them, to be fed to the Elder Brain or used in the Necromancer's experiments)

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_InfernalVendor.lsj
Synopsis:
A merchant selling in the bazaar on the ground floor of Moonrise Tower. She is very interested in illithid-tainted blood from each race, which when traded grants a different kind of potion as a reward. The player can also learn her house's origins - and the fact that she's here to research the illithids. For nodes marked as OOM AND COM are in their own dialog file For nodes not marked as OOM or COM the dialog will have these speakers: 1. Araj 2. Group_Players (that might include Astarion since the default dialog and AOM version are pretty much the same).

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_InfernalVendor_PAD_FeelingSick.lsj
Synopsis:
The player has given blood to the Infernal Vendor to make a unique potion. Once this potion is used, the player who gave the blood will feel sick after long rest (applying a debuff). The potion's effect depends on the player, but the debuff is universal.

0:0 - Gods damn it. What was in that potion?

2:0 - Oh gods - my stomach's in bits.
3:0 - Ugh, my stomach. Not sure that potion was worth it.
4:0 - Ugh, I feel awful. that potion's hit me like rancid butter ale.
5:0 - Ugh - that potion's near wrecked my innards.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_Jailbreak_FlirtyTiefling.lsj
Synopsis:
Lakrissa is a tiefling from the grove who is usually quiet flirty and mischievious but has been through hell and back. There is a hint of her joyful nature here but she's much more reserved. She is currently imprisoned in moonrise towers. She usually has one liners, but if lia is dead she delivers the main beats about the tiefling rescue.

Synopsis:
Quick VB about the prisoners and the fate that awaits them. This is mainly used to draw attention to them as the players explore the prison area.

0:0 - That smell... Despair, desperation - prisoners!
1:0 - The stench, the filth... gods, what a horror to be imprisoned in such a place.
2:0 - Prisoners. We can't leave them here.
3:0 - A throng of prisoners, awaiting their turn for execution - or infection.
4:0 - Prisoners. Not long for this world.
5:0 - Prisoners? We can't just leave them to suffer.
6:0 - Prisoners. More unwilling flesh for the Absolute's schemes.
7:0 - The cult's prisoners become its soldiers. We should not leave them here.
8:0 - Prisoners. I doubt they'll last long in here.

> Do be careful, I don't much fancy a stay behind bars. If we plan to open the doors for these poor souls, we must do so quietly, or risk joining them. Can't risk getting locked up ourselves. I don't want to end up like them. Let's behave - or at least pretend to behave. If we rouse the cultists' suspicions, we could meet the same fate. That's where we'll end up if we're not careful. Exercise caution. I do not want to end up in these cells again. We cannot help them just now. Let us not arouse any suspicion. Careful. One wrong move and we'll be behind bars with them.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_Jailbreak_ProdigySister.lsj
Synopsis:
This is lia's main dialogue in moonrise towers. She's been taken captive (along with her brother cal) - she doesn't know if her other brother rolan is alive or dead. Lia is brave and used to being in tough situations, but she's terrified for herself anf her brother (and trying to mask it with anger). Her main dialogue occurs with her in a cell and speaking to the player on the other side of the bars. There are additional branches for when she's in one cell and the player was arrested an in the cell next to her.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_Jailbreak_Wulbren.lsj
Synopsis:
Wulbren is the leader of the Ironhand Gnomes. He is currently imprisoned in moonrise towers. He has the lazy charm of arrogant and the determination and cunning of the leader of a revolution. In this dialogue he offers you the main quest - to free him and the tieflings from the prison. He can speak to you through the bars - either with the player in prison, OR with the player speaking to them from the outside. NOTE: Wulbren pushes hard to charm the player and make them think they're friends. He keeps the friendly and charming mask on tight (dropping it only when he insults the player). We can have the lightest touch of menace in this dialogue, a hint that he's holding something back or that there is more to this than it seems, but it should be a light touch. He is friendly and charming here (the mask will drop back at Haven when he is rescued).

null
uid: 0183f949-07b2-6683-8539-670bb3fbae90
- 0 Check flag(s) (Object):
   true - MOO_Jailbreak_State_TieflingEscape - Prisoner must go free tieflings as part of their escape.

Synopsis:
The player found and read the letter written by Melodia, wife of Ketheric (string name: MOO_KethericsChambers_NoteFromWife). It is found in Ketherics room under a loose floor board. Reading this letter opens the option to have Ketheric stand down during the colony fight (he still dies). The VB helps support the notion that this letter is significant.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_WallTentacle_Tentacle.lsj
Synopsis:
Upon interacting with the tentacle living inside the tower's wall, player is faced with several options to choose from. - Take a sample (can be used in Mig mini quest) - Poke to see how it reacts - Examine it to learn more about it - Tear it down with brute force Damage being done onto the tentacle will trigger a reaction from the Absolute

0:0 - *The presence is no longer approaching you, but encircling you. Observing you.*
uid: 01c7cb48-840e-d82a-b17c-1b65b1b55e6b
> ---disgraced-- -master-
 -heir--- ---tyrant-
 ---DARK-- ---URGE-
> -child--- -enemy--
 --of- ----hunter-
 -GITH-- ----SLAYER-
> -other-
-else-
-ABERRATION?-

> Go limp and ride it out.
> Invite the presence in. There's always room for one more.
> Do nothing.

Synopsis:
A True Soul oversees some gnolls in the kitchen. They're uncharacteristically quiet, and she explains that the Absolute has given her the ability to 'bring out the good' in then. In truth she is simply dominating them - she'll demonstrate by forcing the gnoll to perform tricks, but we can subvert her power and let the gnoll kill her.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_MintharaFate_Drow.lsj
Synopsis:
Minthara is being psychically tortured in the Moonrise Tower dungeon, having been sent there for failing in her mission to capture the weapon the Absolute was seeking (the Orpheus artefact). Two drow guards are torturing her, but they do not lay a finger on her. Instead, they have stripped away her psychic defenses and are using mind-melds to destroy her from the inside. The player can free her by killing the guards, or by mind-melding with Minthara and pulling her out of the despair. If she is freed from the mind-meld while the guards are alive, she kills them. The player can also destroy Minthara completely, by telepathically lobotomising her inside her own mind.

Two drow guards are torturing her, but they do not lay a finger on her. Instead, they have stripped away her psychic defenses and are using mind-melds to destroy her from the inside. File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_MintharaFate_PAD_HelpMinthara.lsj
Synopsis:
When party exits Moonrise after Execution scene, if player have not started helping Minthara in any way we play this PAD to remind about her.

0:0 - You know, Minthara's still locked up somewhere in there. We could save her... Or not.
1:0 - Minthara's still locked in the towers. I am hardly fond of her - but she might be of use.
2:0 - Minthara's still locked in the cells below Moonrise. We should go back for her - she'd do the same for us. Probably.
3:0 - Perhaps we should consider helping Minthara. She may be a useful person to owe us a favour.
4:0 - Minthara's still imprisoned in Moonrise. If I were inclined, I could save her. Not that I'm inclined.
5:0 - Minthara's imprisoned here. She could probably be saved, if you didn't have a conscience.
6:0 - Minthara may prove useful to us, should we wish to save her...
7:0 - Minthara was dragged to the prison in Moonrise. If she's still there, this is our last chance to save her.
uid: 8efb3173-a4ef-465d-bf08-012408fff1be

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\MoonriseTowers\MOO_MintharaFate_Torture.lsj
Synopsis:
Minthara is being psychically tortured in the Moonrise Tower dungeon, having been sent there for failing in her mission to capture the weapon the Absolute was seeking (the Orpheus artefact). Two guards are torturing her, but they do not lay a finger on her. Instead, they have stripped away her psychic defenses and are using mind-melds to destroy her from the inside. The player can free her by killing the guards, or by mind-melding with Minthara and pulling her out of the despair. If she is freed from the mind-meld while the guards are alive, she kills them. The player can also destroy Minthara completely, by telepathically lobotomising her inside her own mind.

Synopsis:
Party reacts to seeing the Colony through the blood aquarium window that separates the Oubliette from the Colony Morgue. The intention here is to strongly imply that we cannot get into the Colony from the Oubliette.

3:0 - Looks like there's something through there. Can't reach it from here, though.
4:0 - There's something back there. I just need to find a way to it.
5:0 - Hey - there's something beyond here. No way of getting through from this pit, though.
6:0 - I can almost see something beyond there... unreachable from here, however.
7:0 - Look - there's something on the other side. No way through from here though.
